description: Burnett +â€Ž -ize, after Sir William Burnett, inventor of the process.

verbs.description: burnettize (third-person singular simple present burnettizes, present participle burnettizing, simple past and past participle burnettized)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To subject (wood, fabrics, etc.) to a process of saturation in a solution of zinc chloride, to prevent decay.
